title: Box Sizing
content:
# Box Sizing



`box-sizing` defines how the `width` and `height` gets applied on an element. It can be useful to play with box-sizing if, for example, an element needs to take a precise amount of space on a page, with its padding and border included. It can take two possible values:




:::tip
Use DevTools ruler functionality to see the difference between each value
::: 

## Content Box

- Default Value
- Width and Size is controlled at the <mark>content</mark> level
- Expands Outwards
- Adding Padding and Border will increase the size of the box.

![](image-kxznhs9q.png)




## Border Box

- Width and Size is controlled at the <mark>border</mark> level
- Expands Inwards
- Padding and Border will be contained inside the box.

![](image-kxzolsra.png)
